title.raw: 《東越列傳》 Treatise on the Eastern Yue

sentences.zh: 閩越王無諸及越東海王搖者，其先皆越王句踐之後也，姓騶氏。
秦已并天下，皆廢為君長，以其地為閩中郡。
及諸侯畔秦，無諸、搖率越歸鄱陽令吳芮，所謂鄱君者也，從諸侯滅秦。
當是之時，項籍主命，弗王，以故不附楚。
漢擊項籍，無諸、搖率越人佐漢。
漢五年，復立無諸為閩越王，王閩中故地，都東冶。
孝惠三年，舉高帝時越功，曰閩君搖功多，其民便附，乃立搖為東海王，都東甌，世俗號為東甌王。

translations.literal: Min Yue king Wu Zhu and Yue Dong Hai king Yao: their ancestors were all descendants of Yue king Gou Jian, of the Zou clan. After Qin unified the empire, it deposed them as rulers and made their lands Minzhong commandery. When the feudal lords rebelled against Qin, Wu Zhu and Yao led the Yue people to submit to Poyang magistrate Wu Rui—the one called Lord Po—and followed the feudal lords in overthrowing Qin. At this time, Xiang Ji controlled the mandate and did not enfeoff them as kings, so they did not attach themselves to Chu. When Han attacked Xiang Ji, Wu Zhu and Yao led the Yue people to aid Han. In the fifth year of Han, Wu Zhu was again established as Min Yue king, ruling the old Minzhong lands with his capital at Dongye. In the third year of Emperor Hui, recognizing the Yue merits from the time of Gao Di, it was said that Lord Yao of Min had many merits and his people were conveniently attached, so Yao was established as Dong Hai king with his capital at Dong'ou, which the common people called the Dong'ou king.

sentences.zh: 後數世，至孝景三年，吳王濞反，欲從閩越，閩越未肯行，獨東甌從吳。
及吳破，東甌受漢購，殺吳王丹徒，以故皆得不誅，歸國。

translations.literal: Several generations later, in the third year of Emperor Jing, King Bi of Wu rebelled and wanted to join with Min Yue, but Min Yue refused to go along, and only Dong'ou followed Wu. When Wu was defeated, Dong'ou accepted Han's bounty and killed King Bi of Wu at Dantu, and therefore all escaped execution and returned to their kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 吳王子子駒亡走閩越，怨東甌殺其父，常勸閩越擊東甌。
至建元三年，閩越發兵圍東甌。
東甌食盡，困，且降，乃使人告急天子。
天子問太尉田蚡，蚡對曰：「越人相攻擊，固其常，又數反覆，不足以煩中國往救也。
自秦時棄弗屬。」
於是中大夫莊助詰蚡曰：「特患力弗能救，德弗能覆；
誠能，何故棄之？
且秦舉咸陽而棄之，何乃越也！
今小國以窮困來告急天子，天子弗振，彼當安所告愬？
又何以子萬國乎？」
上曰：「太尉未足與計。
吾初即位，不欲出虎符發兵郡國。」
乃遣莊助以節發兵會稽。
會稽太守欲距不為發兵，助乃斬一司馬，諭意指，遂發兵浮海救東甌。
未至，閩越引兵而去。
東甌請舉國徙中國，乃悉舉眾來，處江淮之閒。

translations.literal: Prince Ziju of Wu fled to Min Yue, resented Dong'ou for killing his father, and constantly urged Min Yue to attack Dong'ou. In the third year of Jian Yuan, Min Yue sent troops to besiege Dong'ou. Dong'ou ran out of food, was in dire straits, and was about to surrender, so sent envoys to urgently report to the Son of Heaven. The Son of Heaven consulted Grand Commandant Tian Fen, who replied: 'The Yue people attacking each other is certainly their custom, and they have repeatedly been fickle, so it is not worth troubling China to go save them. Since Qin times they have been abandoned and not governed.' Then Zhong Dafu Zhuang Zhu interrogated Fen: 'The special worry is not that strength cannot save them, nor that virtue cannot cover them; If we truly can, why abandon them? Moreover, Qin took Xianyang and abandoned it—how much more so with Yue! Now a small kingdom comes to urgently report distress to the Son of Heaven, and if the Son of Heaven does not revive it, where should they go to make their complaints? And how then to govern the ten thousand kingdoms?' The emperor said: 'The Grand Commandant is not sufficient to plan with. I have just ascended the throne and do not wish to issue tiger tallies to mobilize troops from the commanderies and kingdoms.' Then dispatched Zhuang Zhu with credentials to mobilize troops from Kuaiji. The Kuaiji Grand Administrator wanted to resist and not send troops, but Zhu executed one Colonel and made clear his intentions, so troops were sent sailing across the sea to save Dong'ou. Before they arrived, Min Yue led troops away. Dong'ou requested to move the entire kingdom to China, so they all moved their people and settled between the Jiang and Huai rivers.

sentences.zh: 至建元六年，閩越擊南越。
南越守天子約，不敢擅發兵擊而以聞。
上遣大行王恢出豫章，大農韓安國出會稽，皆為將軍。
兵未踰嶺，閩越王郢發兵距險。
其弟餘善乃與相、宗族謀曰：「王以擅發兵擊南越，不請，故天子兵來誅。
今漢兵眾彊，今即幸勝之，后來益多，終滅國而止。
今殺王以謝天子。
天子聽，罷兵，固一國完；
不聽，乃力戰；
不勝，即亡入海。」
皆曰「善」。
即鏦殺王，使使奉其頭致大行。
大行曰：「所為來者誅王。
今王頭至，謝罪，不戰而耘，利莫大焉。」
乃以便宜案兵告大農軍，而使使奉王頭馳報天子。
詔罷兩將兵，曰：「郢等首惡，獨無諸孫繇君丑不與謀焉。」
乃使郎中將立丑為越繇王，奉閩越先祭祀。

translations.literal: In the sixth year of Jian Yuan, Min Yue attacked Nan Yue. Nan Yue observed the Son of Heaven's covenant and did not dare arbitrarily send troops to attack, but reported it instead. The emperor dispatched Grand Messenger Wang Hui from Yuzhang and Grand Provisioner Han An Guo from Kuaiji, both as generals. Before the troops crossed the ranges, Min Yue king Ying sent troops to block the defiles. His younger brother Yu Shan then plotted with the chancellor and clansmen, saying: 'The king arbitrarily sent troops to attack Nan Yue without permission, so the Son of Heaven's troops have come to execute him. Now the Han troops are numerous and strong; if we luckily defeat them now, more will come later, and it will end with the kingdom's destruction.' Now let us kill the king to apologize to the Son of Heaven.' If the Son of Heaven listens, he will dismiss the troops and certainly preserve the kingdom intact; If he does not listen, then we will fight with all our strength; If we do not win, we will flee into the sea.' All said: 'Good.' Immediately assassinated the king and sent envoys to present his head to the Grand Messenger. The Grand Messenger said: 'What we came for was to execute the king. Now that the king's head has arrived and they have apologized for their crimes, we can avoid battle and reap the harvest—there is no greater advantage.' Then, acting on his own discretion, he halted the troops and informed the Grand Provisioner's army, while sending envoys to present the king's head and gallop to report to the Son of Heaven. An edict dismissed the two generals' troops, saying: 'Ying and the others were the chief culprits, only Wu Zhu's grandson Lord Rou Chou did not participate in the plotting.' Then sent a Palace Attendant in charge of cavalry to establish Chou as Yue Rou king, to maintain the ancestral sacrifices of Min Yue.

sentences.zh: 餘善已殺郢，威行於國，國民多屬，竊自立為王。
繇王不能矯其眾持正。
天子聞之，為餘善不足復興師，曰：「餘善數與郢謀亂，而後首誅郢，師得不勞。」
因立餘善為東越王，與繇王并處。

translations.literal: Yu Shan had already killed Ying, his authority ran throughout the kingdom, many of the people attached to him, so he secretly established himself as king. King Rou was unable to correct his followers and hold to righteousness. When the Son of Heaven heard of it, he considered Yu Shan not worth raising troops again for, saying: 'Yu Shan repeatedly plotted rebellion with Ying, but then was the first to execute Ying, so the troops were spared labor.' Therefore established Yu Shan as Dong Yue king, to dwell alongside King Rou.

sentences.zh: 至元鼎五年，南越反，東越王餘善上書，請以卒八千人從樓船將軍擊呂嘉等。
兵至揭揚，以海風波為解，不行，持兩端，陰使南越。
及漢破番禺，不至。
是時樓船將軍楊仆使使上書，願便引兵擊東越。
上曰士卒勞倦，不許，罷兵，令諸校屯豫章梅領待命。

translations.literal: In the fifth year of Yuan Ding, when Nan Yue rebelled, Dong Yue king Yu Shan submitted a memorial requesting to lead eight thousand troops to follow General Lou Chuan in attacking Lu Jia and the others. When the troops reached Jieyang, he used rough seas as an excuse not to proceed, played both sides, and secretly communicated with Nan Yue. When Han broke Panyu, he did not arrive. At this time, General Lou Chuan Yang Pu sent an envoy to submit a memorial, wishing to conveniently lead troops to attack Dong Yue. The emperor said the soldiers were weary and tired, did not permit it, dismissed the troops, and ordered the various officers to encamp at Yuzhang Meiling to await orders.

sentences.zh: 元鼎六年秋，餘善聞樓船請誅之，漢兵臨境，且往，乃遂反，發兵距漢道。
號將軍騶力等為「吞漢將軍」，入白沙、武林、梅嶺，殺漢三校尉。
是時漢使大農張成、故山州侯齒將屯，弗敢擊，卻就便處，皆坐畏懦誅。

translations.literal: In the autumn of the sixth year of Yuan Ding, Yu Shan heard that Lou Chuan had requested to execute him, with Han troops approaching the borders and about to advance, so he rebelled and sent troops to block the Han roads. He titled generals Zou Li and others as 'Han-Devouring Generals', entered Baisha, Wulin, and Meiling, and killed three Han officers. At this time, Han had sent Grand Provisioner Zhang Cheng and former Lord Chi of Shanzhou to lead the encampments, but they did not dare attack, retreated to convenient places, and all were executed for cowardice and timidity.

sentences.zh: 餘善刻「武帝」璽自立，詐其民，為妄言。
天子遣橫海將軍韓說出句章，浮海從東方往；
樓船將軍楊仆出武林；
中尉王溫舒出梅嶺；
越侯為戈船、下瀨將軍，出若邪、白沙。
元封元年冬，咸入東越。
東越素發兵距險，使徇北將軍守武林，敗樓船軍數校尉，殺長吏。
樓船將軍率錢唐轅終古斬徇北將軍，為御兒侯。
自兵未往。

translations.literal: Yu Shan carved a 'Wu Di' seal to establish himself, deceived his people with false words. The Son of Heaven dispatched General Heng Hai Han Shuo from Gouzhang, sailing across the sea from the east; General Lou Chuan Yang Pu from Wulin; Colonel Wang Wen Shu from Meiling; And the Yue marquis as Spear Boat and Rapids General, from Ruoye and Baisha. In the winter of the first year of Yuan Feng, they all entered Dong Yue. Dong Yue had already sent troops to block the defiles, appointed Xun Bei General to defend Wulin, defeated several officers of the Lou Chuan army, and killed the senior officials. General Lou Chuan led Qian Tang garrison commander Zhong Gu to execute the Xun Bei General, and was enfeoffed as Marquis of Yu'er. Since the troops had not yet gone.

sentences.zh: 故越衍侯吳陽前在漢，漢使歸諭餘善，餘善弗聽。
及橫海將軍先至，越衍侯吳陽以其邑七百人反，攻越軍於漢陽。
從建成侯敖，與其率，從繇王居股謀曰：「餘善首惡，劫守吾屬。
今漢兵至，眾彊，計殺餘善，自歸諸將，儻幸得脫。」
乃遂俱殺餘善，以其眾降橫海將軍，故封繇王居股為東成侯，萬戶；
封建成侯敖為開陵侯；
封越衍侯吳陽為北石侯；
封橫海將軍說為案道侯；
封橫海校尉福為繚嫈侯。
福者，成陽共王子，故為海常侯，坐法失侯。
舊從軍無功，以宗室故侯。
諸將皆無成功，莫封。
東越將多軍，漢兵至，棄其軍降，封為無錫侯。

translations.literal: Former Yue Yan marquis Wu Yang was previously in Han, and Han sent him back to persuade Yu Shan, but Yu Shan would not listen. When General Heng Hai arrived first, Yue Yan marquis Wu Yang rebelled with seven hundred men from his fief and attacked the Yue army at Hanyang. Following Jian Cheng marquis Ao and his commanders, together with King Rou's Ju Gu, they plotted: 'Yu Shan is the chief culprit, coercing and guarding us dependents. Now Han troops have arrived, numerous and strong; let us plan to kill Yu Shan, surrender ourselves to the various generals, and perhaps luckily escape.' Then they all killed Yu Shan and surrendered their forces to General Heng Hai, so King Rou's Ju Gu was enfeoffed as Dong Cheng marquis with ten thousand households; Jian Cheng marquis Ao was enfeoffed as Kai Ling marquis; Yue Yan marquis Wu Yang was enfeoffed as Bei Shi marquis; General Heng Hai Shuo was enfeoffed as An Dao marquis; Heng Hai Colonel Fu was enfeoffed as Liao Yi marquis. Fu was a son of King Gong of Cheng Yang, formerly Marquis of Hai Chang, but lost his marquisate for violating the law. He had previously followed the army without merit, but was made a marquis because of his imperial clan status. The various generals had no successful merits and none were enfeoffed. Dong Yue general Duo Jun, when Han troops arrived, abandoned his army and surrendered, and was enfeoffed as Wu Xi marquis.

sentences.zh: 於是天子曰東越狹多阻，閩越悍，數反覆，詔軍吏皆將其民徙處江淮閒。
東越地遂虛。

translations.literal: Then the Son of Heaven said Dong Yue was narrow with many obstacles, Min Yue fierce and repeatedly fickle, and decreed that the military officials should all lead their people to relocate between the Jiang and Huai. Dong Yue lands were thus emptied.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：越雖蠻夷，其先豈嘗有大功德於民哉，何其久也！
歷數代常為君王，句踐一稱伯。
然餘善至大逆，滅國遷眾，其先苗裔繇王居股等猶尚封為萬戶侯，由此知越世世為公侯矣。
蓋禹之餘烈也。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Though Yue were barbarians, did their ancestors ever have great merits and virtues for the people? How enduring they were! Through several generations they constantly served as rulers, with Gou Jian alone styling himself hegemon. Yet Yu Shan committed great rebellion, destroying the kingdom and moving the people, but their ancestral descendants like King Rou's Ju Gu were still enfeoffed as marquises with ten thousand households, from which we know Yue generation after generation served as dukes and marquises. It was indeed the lingering influence of Yu.
